creditline: Gift of funds from Beverly Grossman
description: four-pronged object different shapes on each end; one is half scythe, one is half moon, and one is z-shaped with curl on end; final prong has pointed end
text: Though it has the shape of a throwing knife (seen nearby), this blade was never intended as a weapon. Too unwieldy and too fragile for combat, it served both as a scepter and a token of currency. Throughout Africa, iron objects were used as a means of exchange, which by definition often symbolized political authority.
title: Scepter
